assessments.status_rationale: None of today’s bullets indicate a federal lawsuit by a major U.S. offshore-wind developer or trade group challenging an offshore-wind halt/pause; the cited climate/energy item is about coal industry support, not offshore-wind litigation.
No bullet reports ServiceNow closing an acquisition of Armis or any confirming SEC filing/press release; the only acquisition headline shown concerns Nvidia and Groq.
Today’s bullets do not reference Aflac, an SEC filing, earnings release, or any disclosed pre-tax charge/reserve tied to a cyber incident.
No item indicates the SEC announced a settled enforcement action primarily alleging violations of the 2023 public-company cybersecurity disclosure timing/controls requirements.

The China-related bullet concerns mineral/rare-earth dominance, but does not describe a new China export-control measure targeting semiconductor-related materials/tools/components with the U.S. explicitly identified as a destination/affected party.

The Venezuela-related news mentions a U.S. pressure campaign/aircraft carrier deployment, but does not include a public statement (per Reuters/Bloomberg/FT/WSJ, court filing, or press statement) from Vitol/Trafigura/Glencore/Mercuria about suspending or winding down Venezuela trading due to U.S. sanctions/enforcement risk.
No bullet indicates the CDC updated U.S. STI treatment guidance to include newly approved gonorrhea antibiotics as recommended/alternative regimens.
None of today’s items describe a peer-reviewed publication of a pilot-scale, fish-inspired biomimetic microplastics filter achieving ≥90% removal in real-world water.
No Department of Education/FSA update is referenced stating involuntary collections have resumed and cumulatively recovered at least $1.0B since resumption.
